intro: Afrohybanthus caffer, commonly known as the African starwood, is a small shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds covered in a sticky, resinous substance. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
